No.46547) Sub: Instructions of Department of Expenditure_ Ministry of Finance vide OM dated 12.11.2020 (3 Nos) regarding (i) Performance Security, (ii) Additional Security Deposit/ Bank Guarantee (BG) in case of Abnormally Low Bids (ALBs) and (iii) Bid Security/ Earnest Money Deposit' In continuation of NHAI's Policy Circular No. 3.1.27 dated 19.11.2020 on above subject, it may be noted that Para-3 of OM No_ F 9/4/2020-PPD dated 12.11.2020 of DoE, Ministry of Finance with the subject Performance Security' says 83_ In view of all above, it is decided to reduce Performance Security from existing 5-10% to 3% of the value of the contract for all existing contracts. However, the benefit of the reduced Performance Security will not be given in the contracts under dispute wherein arbitration/ court proceedings have been already started or are contemplated. 2_ In order to comply with the above instructions of Ministry of Finance, PD/ RO/ HQ shall check the above aspect while processing such proposals and not entertain any such requests in the contracts under dispute in which the arbitration/ court proceedingshavebeen already started: 3_ Where arbitration/ court proceedings have not been started and the Concessionaire/ Contractor / Consultant (as applicable) of the existing contract is intending to reduce the performance security to 3%, it has been decided to it acknowledged from them that they have no claims what so ever with respect to the existing contract as on the date of request, in order to avoid arbitration/ court proceedings under such existingcontract. 4 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
